captions.text:
>>HEY.
WELCOME TO TEDDY'S STORY JOINT.

CAN I TAKE YOUR ORDER?
>>ACTUALLY, I JUST GOT HIRED.

>>OH, YOU MUST BE WHITNEY.
>>YEAH.

>>HERE, COME ON BACK.
I'LL SHOW YOU AROUND.

>>OKAY.
>>ALL RIGHT, SO THE WAY THIS PLACE WORKS IS,

ANYONE WRITING A BOOK, YOU KNOW,
FOR A NOVEL, MOVIE,

TV SHOW-- >>RIGHT.
>>THEY COME IN HERE AND WE SELL THEM PLOTS

AND CHARACTERS,
YOU KNOW?

ANYTHING THEY COULD WANT.
>>SHOULDN'T THEY BE WRITING THOSE THEMSELVES?

>>[LAUGHTER] YOU'RE CUTE.
HEY JANE AUSTEN.

HOW ARE YOU?
SHE'S A REGULAR.

>>I'D LIKE A PLOT TODAY, THE USUAL.
>>ALL RIGHT.

>>UH, WHAT'S THE USUAL?
>>GIRL LIKES A GUY, LOOKS LIKE SHE

WON'T GET THE GUY, BUT THEN SHE DOES.
WITH THE WITTY SOCIAL CRITIQUE ON THE SIDE.

>>YOU KNOW HOW I LIKE IT.
>>ALL RIGHT.

ORDER UP.
>>ALL SINGLE WOMEN THANK YOU.

>>WAIT, SO YOU'RE SAYING THAT SHE
USES THE SAME PLOT IN EVERY BOOK?

>>EVERY BOOK, YEAH.
>>WELL, THAT'S WRONG.

>>HEY GEORGE LUCAS, J.K. ROWLING.
>>HOW ARE YOU?

>>HI, TEDDY.
I'D LIKE A PROTAGONIST.

WHITE, TEENAGE MALE, EVERYONE
CALLS HIM THE CHOSEN ONE.

>>OH.
I'LL HAVE WHAT HE'S HAVING.

>>AND HOW WOULD YOU LIKE THEM COOKED?
>>UH, LET'S GO WITH NEVER KNEW HIS PARENTS,

RAISED BY HIS AUNT AND UNCLE,
TRAINED BY A WISE OLD MAN.

>>YES, I WANT IT.
>>ANYTHING ON THE SIDE?

>>OH HOW ABOUT, POSSESSES
POWERS HE DOESN'T KNOW ABOUT.

GREAT AT FLYING, SUPER WHINY.
>>MHM.

I WILL GET THE SAME THANK YOU.
>>ANYTHING ELSE?

>>NO.
>>OKAY.

>>UH, YES.
CAN I GET A SMALL ORDINARY OBJECT WITH THE

DARK
LORD'S SOUL INSIDE IT?

>>OH, ACTUALLY WE JUST SOLD OUR
LAST ONE TO MR. TOLKIEN.

>>UGH, MUGGLES.
>>GREAT.

NOW TWO HUGE SAGAS ARE GOING TO
HAVE THE EXACT SAME MAIN CHARACTERS.

>>UH, HARRY WEARS GLASSES.
THANK YOU.

>>YOU KNOW WHITNEY YOU REMIND ME
OF OUR OTHER EMPLOYEE MATT.

HE USED TO HAVE A PROBLEM WITH THE WORK TOO, BUT NOW--
>>HEY BOSS,

THE NEW BATCH OF CHARACTERS CAME IN REAL BLAND.
>>JUST SAVE IT FOR THE NEW TWILIGHT BOOK.

>>YOU GOT IT.
>>OKAY, I REFUSE TO BE A PART OF A COMPANY

THAT PLAGIARIZES.
>>WHOA, WE DO NOT PLAGIARIZE.
>>UM, I'M WRITING <em>THE LIFE OF PI</em> AND I'D LIKE TO GET A

MAN WHO BEFRIENDS A TIGER AND NO
ONE BELIEVES HIM.

>>MATT, HEAT UP <em>CALVIN AND HOBBES .</em>
>>COMING UP!

>>OKAY.
REALLY?

>>YOU KNOW WHITNEY, YOU NEED TO
GET OFF OF YOUR HIGH HORSE OKAY?

I MEAN TAKE EARNEST HEMINGWAY HERE.
WITHOUT OUR HELP, HE'D STILL BE ON THE STREETS.

>>HEY, UH, HEY TED.
I'M A LITTLE SHORT ON CHANGE.

COULD I GET SOME CHEAP CHARACTERS?
>>ALL RIGHT, THAT WILL BUY YOU AN OLD

MAN AND BECAUSE I LIKE YOU, I'LL
THROW IN THE SEA.

THERE YOU GO.
>>THIS IS GOING TO BE SO BORING.

>>ALL THOSE POOR HIGH-SCHOOLERS.
>>YOU SEE ALL THE GOOD WE DO?

NOT TO MENTION THE HELP WE GIVE THE FILM INDUSTRY.
>>HEY, TEDDY!

>>HEY MISTER BRUCKHEIMER!
HOW ARE YOU?

>>GOING TO GET A REFILL ON <em>PIRATES
OF THE CARIBBEAN.</em>

>>AGAIN?
YOU KNOW THEY GET MORE WATERED DOWN AFTER

EACH ONE.
>>YEAH, I DON'T CARE.

>>WHOA, WHOA.
DON'T SHAKE IT UP TOO MUCH.

I WANT IT TO TASTE EXACTLY LIKE
THE FIRST FOUR.

>>HEY BOSS, WE JUST HAD A BIG
GREASE FIRE EXPLOSION IN THE KITCHEN.

>>GIVE IT TO MICHAEL BAY.
>>YEP.

>>OKAY, TEDDY, THIS HAS GOT TO STOP.
STORY TELLING IS BASED ON ARTISTIC INTEGRITY.

YOU HAVE TO SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN.
>>WHOA, WE SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN AND THE WHOLE

NATION CRUMBLES.
YOUR POLITICIANS NEED US.

>>WHAT?
>>HEY MR. SENATOR.

>>TEDDY, HOW ARE YOU?
>>I'M DOING GOOD.

>>OKAY, SO LOOK HERE WE HAVE THREE EMBEZZLEMENTS,
TWO SCANDALS, A DEBT CRISIS,

AND WHOLE LOT OF CAMPAIGN CORRUPTION.
SO WE'RE GOING TO NEED A LOT OF REALLY GREAT

STORIES TO GO.
>>OKAY.

THERE YOU GO.
>>AH.

SMELLS BELIEVABLE.
LET'S GO.

comments.author: Coral Roper

comments.text:
If storytelling worked that way, the whole world would be famous authors. 
The world's creativity would crumble into smithereens and anyone who liked 
writing for themselves would basically be useless compared to that.
So, let's NEVER allow it to happen.

And yeah
Star Wars and Harry Potter have the same plot with different charecters and 
different settings. But, you'd never know if no one said anything.
Books aren't just their plots, they're what direction the author takes 
them.﻿

comments.author: Lily Miles

comments.text:
*TEDDY'S*
*MENU*

***ENTREE'S***
*Complex Protagonist*
This popular dish is full of drama in every bite as the hero overcomes many 
obstacles to become everyone's favorite.

*Allegory Alliteration*
A Surprising Story Set in Sicily. It Surely Shall get you pondering about 
the real meaning of Sally Selling Seashells by the Seashore.

*Frustrating Antagonist*
This tasty treat will keep you on your toes by creating conflict. You never 
know what you are going to experience next.

***SIDES*** (Guaranteed to spice up your main dish)
*Plot Twist*
Your choice of unexpected death, best friend betrayal, living in an 
alternate reality, or a real pleaser; Deus ex machina

*Irony*
Not what you would normally expect but sure to be-
(It gets cut off there, sorry.)﻿
